units.title: Day 13 labeling and washing
units.text:
Day 13: on day 13 of monolayer differentiation, label the required number of six-well Transwell plates for organoid generation. If performing PT functionality assays and immunofluorescence outlined below, 2.5 Transwell plates will be required.
Aspirate the CDBLY2 medium from each well of differentiated hPSC, wash with 1 mL/well of room temperature TrypLE Select, then aspirate and replace with a fresh 1 mL of TrypLE Select.
units.rationale: Marks the transition from monolayer culture to organoid generation and prepares cells for detachment.

units.title: Cell detachment and single‑cell suspension
units.text:
Incubate plate at 37 °C for 3 min.
While the cells are incubating, place 1 mL of room temperature E6 containing 2% FBS into a 15 mL conical tube (one tube for every three or four wells of a 12-well plate).
Gently detach the cells from the well surface by pipetting up and down a maximum of six times using a P1000 pipette, dissociating to a single-cell suspension.
Resuspend the cell pellet to a final volume of 2 mL of E6/2% FBS final volume, adding the medium gradually with a P1000 pipette and gently triturating the pellet during medium addition to resuspend to a single-cell suspension using minimal pipetting.
units.rationale: Creates a uniform single‑cell suspension needed for accurate micromass formation.

units.title: Cell counting and volume calculation
units.text:
Immediately remove 10 µL of the cell suspension for counting with a hemocytometer. Typically, prolonged differentiation in CDBLY2 will yield 5 × 10^6 cells per well. A minimum of 11.25 × 10^6 cells will be required for 45 organoids to perform both PT functional assays and immunofluorescence outlined below.
Calculate the cell suspension volume required for 250,000 cells and dispense this volume into individual 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes, allowing one tube per organoid (Fig. 1). For the generation of 45 organoids, we recommend preparing two or three extra tubes of 250,000 cells in case the cell micromass breaks during aspiration.
units.rationale: Ensures the correct number of cells are allocated to each organoid micromass.

units.title: Micromass centrifugation and resuspension
units.text:
Top up the medium volume in each tube to 200 µL with E6/2% FBS.
Centrifuge tubes three times at 300g for 3 min, rotating the tubes 180° between each centrifugation step.
Following the third centrifugation, use a P200 pipette with a wide‑bore tip to gently push each cell pellet down to the base of the tube and aspirate the micromass into the pipette tip opening.
units.rationale: Compacts the cells into a micromass while preserving viability for transfer.

units.title: Transfer micromasses to Transwell inserts
units.text: Transfer three micromasses to each Transwell insert, working swiftly without delay. Ensure minimal medium carryover by allowing each micromass to settle into the pipette tip opening before dispensing in a single droplet that is touched onto the Transwell membrane.
units.rationale: Places the cell aggregates onto the scaffold where organoid development will occur.

units.title: CHIR pulse
units.text: Once all cell micromasses have been added to the membranes, perform a CHIR pulse by adding 1 mL of E6‑containing 5 µM CHIR99021 to the base of the Transwell and incubating the cell micromasses for precisely 1 h in the 37 °C incubator.
units.rationale: Temporarily activates WNT signaling to promote nephron patterning.

units.title: FGF9/heparin medium change
units.text: Following the CHIR pulse, replace the medium with E6 containing 200 ng/mL FGF9 and 1 µg/mL heparin to initiate organoid patterning.
units.rationale: Provides growth factors that drive metanephric mesenchyme maturation.

units.title: Albumin uptake assay setup
units.text:
Day 27: prepare two 15 mL conical tubes for the ‘test’ (with albumin) and ‘control’ (without albumin) conditions, each containing 4 mL of E6 medium.
Add 4 µL of TRITC–albumin to 4 mL of E6 within ‘test’ conical tube (1:1,000 dilution).
Remove a Transwell plate with six wells of day 27 (equivalent to D13 + 14 in the original related research6) PT‑enhanced organoids from the incubator. Label three wells ‘test’ and three wells ‘control’.
Aspirate culture medium from wells then add TRITC–albumin to ‘test’ wells and plain E6 to ‘control’ wells, first adding a drop on top of each organoid, then dispensing the remaining 1 mL to the basolateral compartment of each Transwell.
Incubate the organoids overnight (~16–20 h) in a 37 °C incubator, during which time the DAPI uptake assay below (Steps 62–73) can be performed on the remaining six wells of live organoids in culture.
units.rationale: Measures megalin/cubilin‑mediated protein uptake as a functional read‑out of proximal tubule maturity.

units.title: DAPI uptake assay for organic cation transport
units.text:
Prepare three 15 mL conical tubes for the ‘substrate’ (with DAPI), ‘inhibitor’ (cimetidine) and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ (DAPI + cimetidine) conditions, each containing 4 mL of E6 medium and 4 µL of DRAQ7 dead cell stain (1:1,000 dilution).
Add 4 µL of DAPI to ‘substrate’ and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ tubes containing 4 mL of E6 (1:1,000 dilution). Mix well.
Add 4 μL of 100 mM cimetidine to ‘inhibitor’ and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ tubes containing 4 mL of E6 (1:1,000 dilution, final concentration 100 µM). Mix well.
Incubate the organoids for 30 min in a 37 °C incubator.
Following incubation, aspirate the inhibitor medium from the control wells, as well as the E6 culture medium from the three test wells.
Add ‘substrate’ medium to the three test wells and ‘substrate + inhibitor’ medium to the three control wells, first adding a drop on top of each organoid, then dispensing the remaining 1 mL to the basolateral compartment of each Transwell.
Incubate the organoids for 1 h in a 37 °C incubator.
units.rationale: Evaluates MATE‑1/MATE‑2 mediated organic cation transport and its inhibition by cimetidine.

units.title: Whole‑mount immunofluorescence staining
units.text:
Retrieve the PFA‑fixed organoids from Step 53 stored in PBS. If the organoids have not yet been removed from the Transwell inserts, prepare a 48‑well plate with 0.5 mL PBS per well.
Lift each Transwell insert from the six‑well Transwell plate and use a sharp scalpel blade to cut the Transwell surrounding each organoid in a small square.
Replace the PBS with 200 µL per well of blocking solution and incubate on a rocking platform at 4 °C for 3–5 h.
Add 150 µL of primary antibody solution to each well and incubate overnight (~16 h) on a rocking platform at 4 °C.
After the final wash, add 150 µL of secondary antibody solution to each well and incubate overnight (~16 h) on a rocking platform at 4 °C (preferably in the dark to further prevent light exposure).
units.rationale: Stains fixed organoids for PT‑specific markers to assess patterning and maturation.
